Reviews.Title: “price was right.”
Reviews.Author: apackerfan
Reviews.Content: looking for basic place to stay, we had early flight out the next day. $51 plus tax on priceline for a wednesday night. neighborhood just ok. because of this, we werent real excited about going out anywhere for dinner. the check in was a bit slow. directions to room not the best. lay out of place is different than any Ive been to, so maybe its on me. room was nice, clean, beds comfortable. turned out we were next to exercise facilities on 3rd floor. room 303. lots of clunking in middle of the night, either that or maybe laundry is located in same area as well. pool looked inviting. they said it was heated so we checked out. if it was heated, it was to about 70. we lasted 2 minutes. others said you can get used to it. jacuzzi was only half full of water. they had happy hour with appetizers on 5th floor restaurant. we did that for dinner. the guy and gal working up there went all out. Ive never seen two people try harder to please their customers. It was impressive. It was also disturbing to see people getting free food and drink and can not even leave a 1 dollar tip. Worst in room coffee Ive ever had. One cup brewing, and I was needing at 4am. I couldn't finish 1 cup. tasted like one teaspoon of coffee for a 12 cup carafe. overall, the price was right and it served our purpose. i would stay here again on same premise of overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: JKNY329_10
Reviews.Content: Got the room at a good rate on Hotwire. Was very impressed for the money. Extremely spacious room with two flat screen TV's and a separate sitting area. Kitchen is a wet bar with small fridge and microwave. No flatware. Great location close to freeways, airport and Biltmore mall. A car is a must though. Aside from the very nice room, huge perk was free breakfast cooked to order and even better, complimentary happy hour with wine, beer and well drinks from 530 to 730 pm. They are served along with a very light snack selection from their restaurant on the fifth floor with a knockout view of Phoenix and Camelback mountain. Almost worth the price just to take advantage of the view. A full menu is available at extra cost but not forced on you. Alas, two things prevent a five star rating from me. One is that in my room, the bathroom sink was located in the bedroom. There was no separation or privacy whatsoever from the sleeping area. That was fine when traveling alone but if with friends or a new romance, it would be awkward. Also, guests cannot control whether the heat or AC is on. Below 55 degrees, only heat is available. Above 70, only AC. In between nothing. As Phoenix temperatures vary WILDLY between day and night, this could be a real problem during shoulder season. I was there in April and wished for a little blast of heat in the morning even though it got into the 80's during the day. A plaque indicates space heaters are available at the front desk but that is not nearly as convenient. As these two items are part of the building structure they can't be changed so be prepared to accept them if you decide to stay here. Otherwise, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: travelin4funfools
Reviews.Content: I travel to Phoenix for business often, our office is off of Camelback Road in the Biltmore area. I normally stay at the Embassy Suites in that area, but this time it was full, even at my Diamond level. Therefore I had to switch hotels. All the hotels in the Biltmore area were full, there must have been a convention or many spring break travelers. This particular Embassy Suites on 24th street is very old and out dated. The interior design must be from the 70’s and has not been updated since. The rooms were clean and the beds were not old, but the overall feel of the hotel and rooms were very old and uncomfortable. When I closed the door to my hotel room I could see light coming in from the outside. That in its self is not too bad as I have had this happen more than once, but the overall look and feel in the room was straight from the 70’s and helped make my first impression worse. I arrived very late and did not have a chance to see if they had room service or if it was good, but the next morning I did try the breakfast buffet and found it to be adequate. The check in area was not updated either, it felt as if they had not remolded since opening day, and as I have already stated the whole hotel felt that same way. I went for my normal morning run and the location of this hotel is in a business section, which is not bad, but other hotels have more to offer in this regard. Like a lot of locations in Phoenix they are by the canal system and I found the running path along the canal, which is much nicer than running through a crime ridden area. Overall this was acceptable, but when I compare this hotel to that of the one on Camelback Road, the Camelback Road location wins hands down. The Camelback location is located in a fantastic area, by the mall with tons of restaurants, and they have a jogging path mapped out through neighborhoods making it feel like home. As far as I’m concerned, if you are going to stay at an Embassy Suites in the Biltmore area the one on Camelback Road is by far much better than this one for about the same nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “First class customer service”
Reviews.Author: bigdog33
Reviews.Content: MY wife and I and 4 other couples from our hometown area traveled to Phoenix to catch the men's NCAA basketball West regionals. WE booked a 3 night stay at the Embassy suites. Without a doubt, in all the years we have traveled and stayed at different properties, this hotel had the best customer service of any of them. The front desk attendants were so helpful with recommendations of local restaraunts and sports bars. The morning breakfast was awesome, cooked to order , however you wanted it and the managers evening happy hour was actually 2 hrs ands the bartender and waitress went out of their way to make us feel special. I would definitely return and would recommend this property to anyone staying in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: IUgrad1975
Reviews.Content: Do not let any of the negative reviews affect your decision to stay here......just know up front what you are getting.....which is an updated, clean 2 room suite, breaksfast just like the ES with the fancy atriums, and an enjoyable Manager's Reception! This hotel reminds me a lot of the NICER hotels along Myrtle Beach......with the beautiful pool and courtyard area in the middle. You would never know you were in the middle of Phoenix! This hotel is very convenient to the airport and car rental return and just a short drive to the Biltmore Shops and other areas of Phoenix like Camelback mountain. Service is great, staff is friendly and accomodating....we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jacko1974
Reviews.Content: I attended a small conference which was hosted at this hotel. I got picked up at the airport by the free hotel shuttle which arrived within 10 minutes after I called the front desk. The shuttle driver gave the passengers a detailed explanation of all the services offered at the hotel during our ride there. Was able to check into my room early by 9.30 am and they offered me to enjoy their wonderful breakfast right after my arrival. My guest room was clean, well equipped, spacious, with a separate living room, two flat screen TVs and a small kitchen. Every morning the current edition of US Today was hanging outside my door for me to enjoy. The hotel building surrounds a centrally located pool area that is accessible until midnight. Free pool towels are provided, and there are plenty of reclining chairs and umbrellas to relax. The only small downside is that parts of the pool area are always in the shade due to the hotel building around it. The best part about the hotel is the generous breakfast which includes - among other things - cooked-to-order omelettes, sausage, bacon, fried potatos, coffee and tea, various fruit juices, joghurts, fresh fruit, various breads, muffins, bagels, etc. Everything is "all you can eat". The other great thing is the nightly 2-hour "happy hour" at the rooftop bar during which they serve snacks and unlimited free beer, wine and well drinks to all hotel guest. This event happens EVERY night, and needless to say it keeps the bar pretty crowded and entertaining. There is not much to do in the immediate neighborhood of the hotel, so if you don't have a car you will feel kind of trapped. But the hotel provides free shuttle rides anywhere within a 3-mile radius of the hotel (not just to the airport), so this is a much-appreciated service. Right across the street there is a Carl's Jr. fast food restaurant which provides cheap, highly delicious and definitely unhealthy food. The hotel has a small business center with free internet access and free printing of boarding passes. In the guest rooms you can get internet access via wifi or ethernet, but this service is charged extra and it is pretty slow. This aspect of my stay was the only thing which was sort of disappointing. Overall I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Older with motel like outdoor corriders”
Reviews.Author: familyfromphilly10
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, convenient and clean. Room was comfortable and breakfast was typical for Embassy Suites with omelettes, pancakes, etc. Pool area in center. Happy hour in upstairs lounge. I wd stay again. This is not a newer Embassy Suites with an atrium.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: TEH3
Reviews.Content: I had the extreme pleasure of being a guest at this property continuously for 16 months and I recommend it without hesitation. The property is older but clean! The main thing this place has going for it is the staff, they work hard to learn their regular and repeat guest's names and needs. I had the misfortune of breaking a leg during my stay and they drove me to the emergency room, and then drove me both ways to and from work every day during my convalescence. The driver would go into the hospital where I worked and get a wheelchair and wheel me inside and then return the wheelchair at the end of the day. They threw me a birthday party, and a one-year anniversary party and I left many friends behind when my assignment ended. This place draws a lot of repeat travelers so mine is not an isolated positive experience, people return when they are made to feel welcome and this place is spelled H-O-S-P-I-T-A-L-I-T-Y. Special thanks to shuttle drivers Johnny De and Travis, to the entire front desk staff, GM Doug, Food and Bev Manager Trey and bartender Jason.

Reviews.Title: “what a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: andy g
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel and all i can say is wow. its not just the hotel itself but the staff. the front desk are very kind, polite and helpful, tyler, amanda, BB, rick are a few of the names that stick with me and the cook at breakfast is such a nice guy who puts in 110% effort into his work as well as the bar staff in the squaw peek cafe on site. The cleaners around the hotel are very good and always say hi as you walk by. But the thing that tells you that you are about to have a good experience before you even arrive are the drivers from the airport Joe and especially Jonny D. These guys make you feel at ease can liven up a shuttle ride from the airport even after a 10 hour flight. I would recommend this hotel above all others i have stayed in around the world, and that is alot of nice hotels i assure you, because of the people at this hotel. Try it you see what i mean Andy g

Reviews.Title: “Bartender for the Manager's reception was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: srmmurfreesboro
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Saturday night before we flew back home on Sunday so we were in and out but felt the service in the Manager's reception area and breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “One of the original Embassy suites”
Reviews.Author: MyZenworks
Reviews.Content: This Hilton property is one of the original Embassy Suites in the chain. Although, the property is older the amenities are quite good. The entry/reception reflect a modern hotel with the pool and hot tub are good for the aging property. The rooms are typical with updated features like bath and shower areas. I was pleased to have good hot water pressure and clean towels. The happy-hour is very well presented with great bar tender and associates. So, it may be older, but I felt worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Past It's Prime”
Reviews.Author: IMFLYBOY
Reviews.Content: As a Hiton Honors Diamond guest I see many Hilton properties around the world and find that this one, an Embassy Suites, is past its prime. Here we have a 1960's vintage MOTEL that has been renovated into a wanna be Embassy facility. It misses the mark on all points except service. The room are 1970s style (painted brick walls) with a musty smell like it's been lived by a high school gym class. While the bed is comfortable and the suites large, they are also dark. The fans make more noise than a blender. The facility is simply run down. The positive aspect is the cheerful service with special note to the short order cook who does the mornign breakfast. To watch him is entertaining. To enjoy his fare is simply a pleasure. But the facility is in despirate need of a make over. And the internet is insufficient in coverage and speed to support business applications. And finally is a note on price. At the Hilton.com website, they listed the room for $199. It isn't worth half this much. But fortunately my company has a special rate that brough the price dow to one that reflects the real condition of this hotel. Bottom line: If you can get in for $80/night and can take time to enjoy the breakfast and pool, go for it. But if it's the $199 that you are quoted, forget it. You'll find a fresher look at the Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Debbie A
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Everyone there was very helpful, and very friendly. The room was a little cool as far as temperature, however the bed was extremely comfy and cozy which more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service!”
Reviews.Author: A R
Reviews.Content: Awesome customer service at Embassy Suites Phoenix Airport! Embassy Suites has been my second home for over a year while finishing out my Master’s degree. When I arrive each week, I am treated like family! Employees go out of their way to make me feel welcome. Though the facility is older, they continuously upgrade. The grounds are well kept with beautiful trees and flowers, which adds a touch of “home”. What the facility may lack in “elegance”, they people make up for 10 fold.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Aaron L
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the Embassy Suites were extremely helpful and caring. The drivers that assist in operating the Shuttles are just awesome. If you ever need to go anywhere, they will be more than happy to help out especially a super nice fellow by the name of Johnny De who drove me around a few times and was super knowledgeable of the city and made my experience all the more special, whether it was making me laugh or playing great music the entire time, it was always a great ride with Johnny De. Embassy is a great hotel, great pool and great staff all around and my time in Phoenix was truly awesome because of them.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh.”
Reviews.Author: PamL0vesT0Travel
Reviews.Content: Hotel was okay but the room we stayed in was very outdated. I think they might be renovating because we were traveling with another party and they said their room was very nice. I'd request a higher floor. Breakfast was EXCELLENT, best omlete I ever had. Pool area looked nice too but it was too cold to use.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia C
Reviews.Content: Over the past several years I had many occasions to stay at this Hotel. From the moment when checking in at the front desk, you know you are welcome. The staff is outstanding. The Hotel is always neat, clean and well kept. Doug, the GM runs a tight ship and it shows. I have stayed in other Embassy Suites Hotels, but this one is by far the Hotel of my choice. If you just need to get away, travel for business, unwind, release some stress, this is where you need to stay. Not to forget the excellent made to order Breakfast in the mornings. Can't get any better than this. I will definitely stay there again. No matter what brings you to Phoenix, business or pleasure, this is your home away from home. Thank you Doug and Lacey for making me feel welcome. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location (not in this instance)”
Reviews.Author: travellerSunnySouth
Reviews.Content: As a business professional who travels often, I would not recommend anyone to book this hotel!! ESPECIALLY SINGLE WOMEN. We had 3 rooms reserved here based on the hotel description and we are pretty loyal to Hilton brands. The location is in an area that is not safe to venture out in the evening. There are catwalk style / shared areas. The doors have gaps underneath so: a) bugs can come into your room, b) you can hear everyone's conversation outside of your room and c) the a/c (if there were any) goes right out the door. The AC was turned off. (This was in early Dec in Phoenix) It was hot. Trust me. The sliding glass door in the room was broken and the towel holder in the bathroom was coming off the hinges. Need I say more? The hotel staff were DELIGHTFUL. I mean that. Truly sweet kids who understood our predicament and gave us a refund on the spot. We did get a room at the Hilton!!

Reviews.Title: “Oldler but would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: JuJuT
Reviews.Content: Hotel is older than the usual Embassy Suites but Tyler the manager was very nice. He moved us to a king room with a better location than our two bed room. Food and employees for breakfast were great! The resturant - not so good. It smelled like water damage and service not so good. Food good though.

Reviews.Title: “There are a lot better ES near by than this one”
Reviews.Author: Faolet
Reviews.Content: If you stay in ES a lot there is a general expectation. This is probably one of the oldest ES in the nation. My room looked old and was 80 degrees with no AC because they have central heating and cooling and only one can be on at a time. It was January so te heat was on. The staff was excellent and moved me to a Hilton Suites just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: bkrite
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The service was excellent, the room was excellent and clean as a whistle. The bed was so comfy I could have slept for week in it. I never heard traffic noise or noise from other rooms. The free breakfast was wonderful and the eggs cooked to order were perfect. We will stay there again and recommend it to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great restaurant on site”
Reviews.Author: gis0610
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our flight got cancelled and received a distressed passenger voucher from the airline. They have a shuttle that picks you up at the airport, the driver was very friendly and pleasant, gave us a mini intro to the city and offered us cool water (it was about 105 degrees that day). We had been travelling all day and were glad that the hotel had a restaurant on site. The food was great and the service was excellent. All the staff was great from the front desk to the cook that makes the omelets (a great complimentary breakfast is offered) . The room and fitness center were clean. If we ever have to stay in this area again we would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sparkles101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Jan 2, 2012 due to cancelled flight home. We arrived after 10PM so didn't really look at the room in depth. Upon awakening, I found 3 bites on my leg, but was in a hurry to get back to the airport to catch my flight so I didn't look around. In the shuttle back to the airport, I overheard a woman say that she had these red bites all over her body and was freaking out. Her friend said that now that she mentioned it, he also had red bites on his body. I immediately started thinking about the bites on my leg and connecting the dots. The employees were curtious and helpful so it's unfortunate that they have this problem. I stayed in room 325 so I would avoid this room!

Reviews.Title: “It's old but they really try to do the best with what they have got”
Reviews.Author: nancyesca
Reviews.Content: The staff is really really good. The Managers happy hour is fun - up on the top floor. We also ate there one night - it was ok. The rooms are sorely dated just by the structure - circa late 60s early 70s. The breakfast is just what you expect at an ES. The diner next door is good for lunch - really a typical diner. There is a Walgreens kitty corner to pick up things. They have ancient A/C - heater - it can only be one thing - for the whole building. Also free internet and printer in the business center - that was a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: rgill12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 12/6-12/9 and everything was great. The experience was better than some other suites we have stayed in. The Squaw Peak Lounge has a great view and the folks that take care of you are superb. Food is excellent and drinks (free-Managers reception). Rooms were great too and up to date, no hunkie TV's here. Clean and well kept. Front desk staff top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: herold1961
Reviews.Content: The ugliest Embassy Suites, but the service from the front desk to the housekeeping staff to the restaurant employees are top notch! Rooms were very quiet, large and clean. The courtyard and pool area was very nice and the property is well maintained. A great location in midtown close to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed at the time”
Reviews.Author: lovept
Reviews.Content: Our flight got cancelled so US Airways gave us a voucher where we received a hotel room for a discounted rate. We are Hilton Honors members and figured due to that, the Embassy Suites would work fine. I would say it served its purpose for this trip. The rooms are older yes, but spacious. The street is sketchy yes, and so are the people lingering around the hotel. I did feel safe once inside the room. The breakfast in the morning which was included was pretty good actually. The shuttle to the airport that was included as well was nice and arrived on time, friendly. The staff at the hotel were friendly as well. If you like 60/70's motif, this hotel is for you and its close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: OnTheLeadLap
Reviews.Content: When I initially pulled in, I was a little upset that the building appeared to be dated and the area seemed a bit shady. Upon registering at the front desk, I was pleasantly surprised with the customer service I received. Each time I needed something during the course of my two day stay, the staff handled it quickly and with a smile on their faces. Also, my room was nice and updated. Breakfast didn't start until around 7 on the weekends, but there is a Jerry's restaurant next door that is open 24 hours. While I first vowed to never stay there again, I would most likely sacrifice the area for great customer service and return.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not a typical Embassy Suites...!”
Reviews.Author: celsius99
Reviews.Content: Extremely dated ES property, really needs a makeover...neighborhood is a little sketchy...! staff is very attentive, friendly and really tries hard...but unfortunately this property is a 3 dressed up as a 3...! Still not the worst ES I have been too, Palm Springs and Corpus Christi are way worse...!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL STAY IN MY LIFE”
Reviews.Author: rubbercitygal330
Reviews.Content: EMBASSY SUITES/HILTON should be ashamed to have there name associated with this hotel. We stayed here prior to flying out of Phoenix and I did not sleep at all that night. I was scared to dead horrible neighborhood and poor security. Appears they have people living at the hotel on a regular basis as there were large dogs and some very scary people walking around and in the elevators. Room was so outdated and dirty and dust were blowing out of all of the vents in the room. I would choose another hotel if I were you, this has totally changed my view on Hilton Hotels - stayed at nice hotels for much less per night!!!! Cannot comment on the food as we did not stay long enough to try!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: skippythetechie
Reviews.Content: From the shuttle driver to the front desk staff to the restaurant staff, everyone there was friendly, helpful and accommodating. High speed internet worked flawlessly. Gym had 3 elliptical, 3 treadmills, a recumbent bike and a nice set of free weights. The complimentary breakfast was very good, as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Not your everyday Embassy Suites!”
Reviews.Author: iluvryno
Reviews.Content: Rough part of town - lock your doors Nice employees - young and unexperienced, but nice Van drivers great - very friendly Room was fine Here's my ONE BIG COMPLAINT. The internet was out ALL DAY the one day I was there. First thing in the morning, 4pm when I got back from a day of meetings and 10pm that night after dinner. For a Hilton property, a brand that caters to business travelers, this is the worst possible scenario. I had to walk over to Dunkin Donuts (across a very busy city street) for wifi. I was offered no compensation, no extra Hilton points, simply nothing. And I did make my displeasure known. Will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing overnight visit”
Reviews.Author: AlgonquinLakeGang
Reviews.Content: This was an unscheduled extra nights stay in Phoenix area due to travel problems. The airline gave a few references for places close to the airport with shuttle service. I brought my bags out gate 8 and to the hotel van pick-up area. As I hit the island at 10:29 I called the hotel, explained the situation of travel problems,asked for a room and if the van was running the airport route. The front desk took my name and it's not easy so I have to spell it. Assurances were given that the van was on the route and would be there in 15-20 minutes. After waiting and seeing a couple of other hotel's shuttles make more than one circuit at I called again 11:06. The individual at the front desk said that he would contact the driver and tell him I was still waiting. In 10 minutes the van arrived. The driver was helpful by putting my luggage in the van. On the way he stated the van running times in the morning were on the half hour and with my gate and time that an hour and a half before flight would be fine. He also stated the van ride was about 8 minutes back to the airport. Based upon this information the deduction is that the driver didn't leave until after my second call. At the front desk Luis didn't find notes of my conversation and booking but would take care of me. Maybe the shift changes at 11? He had a double non-smoking room that will work. Only the room key in its folder was given to me and I went to the room to grab about 4 hours of sleep to return on the 4:30 am shuttle. The non-smoking room smelled like it was converted to non-smoking by using a can of air freshener. The stale smoke smell was very evident. If it was earlier then midnight then getting another room would have been attempted. In the morning I grabbed the bill from the floor and there was a second bill also slipped under my door; neither of the envelopes had a room number. I opened the wrong room first and saw that traveler's room rate was $84. Okay not too bad but better can be had for this slow summer season. Then I opened the second one with my room and name and saw $119. Distressed traveler pays $35 or extra 41% more. Shameful business practice from this hotel. I briefly complained when returning the wrong bill to Luis but this fell on deaf ears. This adventure leads me to advise against this hotel for travel. Also, I have been weighing Hilton Honors status when traveling but this experience will drop that influence on the decision, too. The ride to the airport and check in to the airport went as the driver stated and that saved the hotel from a terrible rating.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for a few days.”
Reviews.Author: rickscholz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights using a gift certificate I had. A few highlights: - ROOM: Very spacious, as you would expect from an all suite hotel. Included a sofabed, 2 full size beds, 2 flat screen tv's, microwave, refrigerator, coffee/tea maker. There wasn't anything I was expecting to find in the room that I didn't find. - PARKING: Free. There is an amply spaced parking lot at the rear of the building. One area lacking is parking for cars checking in near the office... it might be a good idea to mark one or two spaces for this purpose. - BREAKFAST: Cooked to order. I just walked up to the counter, and they asked "What do you want for breakfast?" Options included eggs, omelets, french toast, and pancakes. They also had as sides of bacon, sausage, and potatoes also served by the chefs. I'm not sure why, but on Friday only, they also had eggs and potatoes served from a buffet line. Other items at breakfast included cereal, pastries, juice, soda, coffee etc. - MANAGERS RECEPTION: Very friendly and fast bartender. I just had soda, but it looked like they had a good selection of other beverages available as well. Snacks included chips and salsa, veggies and dip, fruit, snack mix, pretzels, and crackers. It's in their restaurant, so if you want to order more substantial food (not free), that option is available as well. - NEIGHBORHOOD AND ENVIRONMENT: Some people have commented negatively about the neighborhood. I would describe it as a somewhat older neighborhood, but I never felt unsafe. Once inside the property, however, everything looks very nice and impeccably maintained. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: holidayers007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel unexpectedly as we had missed our connecting flight. We phoned the hotel from the airport. They sent a free shuttle to come and collect us and checked us in promptly. The hotel offered daily a Managers Drinks which consisted of all basis spirits, beers and house wines and a range of snacks in the Restaurant. Also offering a free breakfast daily with a free egg bar. The service we received was exceptional. Computers, printers and free wi fi were also available for use. The one bedroom we stayed in was clean spacious and amenities were generous.

Reviews.Title: “40 years old and showing it”
Reviews.Author: Loritaw
Reviews.Content: They are trying hard and the room was clean but VERY dated with the sink in the bedroom and the toilet and tub shower in a separate tiny room. The lounge on the top floor was dark and dingy, the breakfast was cooked to order by a chef with an open grill that needed a good cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Hilton is Rolling Over in His Grave!”
Reviews.Author: parafrog
Reviews.Content: It did not start well. Ever been in a neighborhood where the hair on the back of your neck stands up, where you look for well lit parking, where you put 911 on your speed dial before getting out of the car? That is where this hotel is located (I did tours in Viet Nam and Beirut). And then it got worse. Run down and shabby, permeated with smoke and other smells I would rather not have identified. It is amazing to me that Hilton's Q/A has allowed this property to remain in the stable. Avoid this property; and Hilton, fix it or take away the franchise.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel - very close to airport”
Reviews.Author: ELICASTLE09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business two nights at this hotel. Rooms clean and comfortable, typical Embassy Suites. I enjoy their managers receiption and hot breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “In the bario. Nuff said?”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCW
Reviews.Content: The pictures on HHonors were clearly done by a pro. The amenities are decent and the rest is to be expected of an Embassy Suites. The location, however, was not so great. I live in Minneapolis near a not-so-good neighborhood and I wouldn't venture into this neigborhood at night. It would appear that many local gangs like to leave their call sign on every wall. Carl's Jr. across the street was no exception. Stick to a more northern hotel and you will be fine. If you need to be "close" to downtown, you won't have much of a choice than to stay in sketchier areas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here - It is that simple!”
Reviews.Author: cwwh
Reviews.Content: Instead of business travelers and tourists, this location caters to the local populace. The result is alcohol fueled non-stop noise late into the night, disregard of hotel rules and common courtesy and abused facilities in a poor state of repair. Our non-smoking room reeked of cigarette smoke from the previous occupant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MEJDoane
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend. Clean, comfortable, courteous. Great way to end a long day after a 4 hour flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ikazi
Reviews.Content: Well maintained, clean hotel. Good pool. And absolutely great rooms. May not be exactly at the airport, but decently close to airport, businesses etc. Would recommend this for business overnighters, probly even couples on a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Fantastic Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: CaroleB915
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, clean, and has a beautiful pool area, but what really sets this hotel apart is the staff!! From our pickup at the airport to our dropoff at the airport 2 days later, each staff member we encountered was incredibly friendly and helpful!! In addition to the wonderful staff, the Manager's Reception each night was fabulous: free drinks and appetizers (excellent chips and salsa made at the hotel!) We had lunch at the cafe also and it was delicious; everything is made fresh there at the hotel. And let's not forget the made to order breakfast each morning....delicious!! The pool was hopping and there were a lot of kids laughing and playing, but when in your room, you can not hear the pool noise which is a definite plus. The pool area is very pretty, too, with plenty of tables, lounge chairs, and towels provided. The next time I'm in Phoenix, I will definitely stay at this hotel. If you are looking for a moderately priced hotel with staff that will make you feel at home, you should stay here, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: Briejean
Reviews.Content: We were in town for only two nights for a family wedding. Two other cousins and their families also stayed. The rooms were so spacious and clean, the included breakfast was nicer than expected... and the pool area was very "resort-like". It was such a great place to hang out with family. I would definitely recommen, asd this hotel to families with young or older children. The room with two full beds is separate from the living area. You have a large kitchen area with small fridge, sink, and microwave, as well as plenty of counter space, two flat screen televisions, a large table to be used as a desk or eating area, and a queen pull out couch. Free shuttle service to the airport too!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service, Bad Emabassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: jarvis.lambert
Reviews.Content: The good news: Staff is very warm, accommodating, and helpful. Nice free shuttle to and from airport. The bad news: Poor location, terrible "managers happy hour", very noisy rooms Not a great Embassy Suites

Reviews.Title: “One little problem!”
Reviews.Author: bmvend
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at this hotel which turns out is an older Embassy Suite property. It probably started out as something else because the bathrooms were inside the bedroom. First the bad part: We had plumbing problems associated with the commode. Every 20 minutes or so it would make a giant sucking sound and the water would empty from the bowl. No big deal, except at night when it constantly woke us up. Management and maintenance kind of shined us on for two nights, then tried to fix but never did. 4 nights with no sleep. Worse they never offered us any kind of refund of our fees. Next was the smokers! They were all over the place and were allowed to smoke around the pool with children present. There were some good points, the staff at the happy hour, dining and breakfast were great! The area surrounding the hotel was not in the best neighborhood, so long walks are not suggested.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a smoker it's a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sprsana
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the pool was nice, the breakfast staff and quality of the free breakfast was great, the front desk was friendly, the happy hour reception was generous,the location was just minutes from spring training.Sounds great,... if you are a smoker. All the rooms claim to be non-smoking but you can smell the smoke on EVERYTHING. The room had a thick cloud in it. We had a sleep with the window and door open the first night because there wasn't another room to put us in. (Our fault, we checked in at midnight, really bad traffic) They were kind and comp'd our room the first night and moved us the next day to a "less smoking room." They tried to make the best of it for us we're just sensitive to smoke I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great and so so at the same time..”
Reviews.Author: randy623
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 2 nights at this hotel for a conference in which I was presenting. It was very close to the airport. Good for me since my flight Sunday left at 5:30am but wouldn't want to stay here to "experience" Phoenix. Free shuttle service was an Executive sedan. Very nice however it took 25 minutes for pick up. The front desk staff was very pleasant. Internet access is $14 bucks a day (cmon Hilton) unless you are a Gold/Platinum Honors member. Guess I was close enough as I got it free of charge. The rooms were decent. All two room suites with modern flatscreens and hi def. Very nice. Hilton Bed is alwas great. The counter tops in the sink area and kitchen need updating along with the wall paper. And the walls that buffered the outside were coated bricks/blocks. Strange for an embassy. It was an outside entry hotel but was kind of neat that all entry was enclosed (does that make sense?). All rooms faced into a courtyard area that had a nice looking pool area and hot tub that I had no time to enjoy. Very different for an Embassy. It seemed as if they took over a Clarion Suites and slapped their info on it. But overall they did a nice job of it. Breakfast and Managers reception was provided. Finger foods and small beers were free. However the bar was completely understaffed with the line for an 8 oz beer about 25 minutes long. Overall a decent stay. On the outside, it doesn't appear to be a very nice Embassy but the rooms were nice and the staff decent.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised--2 week stay went well”
Reviews.Author: DanielMaxson
Reviews.Content: I always read TripAdvisor reviews before booking reservations but this time, the Hotel was chosen by my business partners because we were having a two week training session there. I still went and checked TA and was disappointed by what I read. Let me say right here, I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel! As it turned out there was a lot of truth in those reviews but I would stay again based on my experience. Yes the hotel is old, but the management is very responsive to complaints. For instance my microwave oven broke down in the middle of making lunch so I called the front desk. Fifteen minutes later I had a brand new microwave. I was a little cold at night, presto, 10 minutes later I had a supplemental heater provided to me (they had already switched over to AC so no heat). The AC worked great on the warm days BTW. The only other problem I had was kiddie noise which usually ended by 11:00 PM. There were a lot of older folks at the Hotel here to watch various MLB Spring training games. They were wonderful and quiet. Now as to my room. It was spotless but dated. The rooms are a good size for anyone staying a week or two on business as I did. I only had a shower but that is fine for me. They are large. If you need a bathtub find another hotel. They have an excellent breakfast with made to order dishes such as omelettes, pancakes and French Toast. They let me fill my Big Gulp cup every morning with Diet Coke before my meeting and I loved them for that! The cooks were excellent and I do mean that. They can cook your omelette in about 3 1/2 minutes and I saw five going at once with no problems. The omelette stuffing choices were excellent too. They make a killer veggie omelette. At night (5:30 PM - 7:30 PM) they have an excellent free manager's appreciation open bar with tortilla chips, salsa, veggies and ranch dressing. They kept the bar full of snacks the entire two hours too. They pour generous well drinks, margaritas, and a few mixed drinks, as well as sodas. It's hard to beat free for these goodies but they do save you money if you are on a budget and who isn't these days? The meeting rooms were excellent. They were roomy and the temperature control was great. The neighborhood does not have a lot of nearby restaurants; however, there are two that are worth mentioning--El Napolito, authentic, inexpensive Mexican fare, and Jerry's an inexpensive diner. The food at both places was very good. I ate dinner at El Napolito 4 times. You can also get a ride to restauarants up to five miles away via the free Hotel Shuttle so that helped a lot. The Shuttle to and from the airport is also free. SO yep it is an older dated hotel, but the management in place at the hotel makes up for this everywhere they can.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeRed
Reviews.Content: It couldn't have been more convenient! When I was unexpectdly re-routed to Phoenix due to weather, this hotel was my salvation. A late arrival was no problem, and I was whisked from the airport in a Cadillac Escalade (sweet!) direct to the hotel, where John, the night auditor was truly welcoming and solicitous. Plenty of hot water and a very comfy bed helped make me ready to travel again, especially in conjunction with the ample full breakfast that has helped make the Embassy brand so successful. Yes, this building is older, but on this, my second stay, I found the arrangement around the courtyard and pool charming all over again. I have stayed in Embassy all over the country and although some are older and some newer, I have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “there's better places out there”
Reviews.Author: iheartlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: My opinion of the hotel is quite neutral...nothing extraordinary happened, and nothing overly awful happened. The hotel is quite old, though the rooms have been renovated to try and hide that. The water dial in the shower was backwards, the direction for hot was really cold, and vice versa. I really enjoy the suite-type hotels, so that was a bonus. The Squaw Peak Cafe is only open for a couple hours at lunch time, and a couple hours in the evening. Not very convenient for an airport hotel - there isn't a lot nearby. I ordered pizza for room service the night I arrived, it was quite gross. Burnt, but still managed to have a very raw center. I don't recommend the restaurant at all. The shuttle is handy and will take you to and from the airport (complimentary), and any place within a 5 mile radius of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast Ever”
Reviews.Author: Antkneee
Reviews.Content: Yes the hotel is old looking...probably the ugliest Embassy Suites I've ever seen. So don't be surprised when you drive up to the location. Now the positives...the staff was amazing! One of the best I've ever seen. The bed was very comfortable. My room had new carpeting and two flat screens but the rest was very old. The managers reception is on the top floor of the hotel with a nice view of mountains and palm trees...we were able to enjoy the sunset every night. This location has the best breakfast ever. The two guys that work here were excellent cooks and very funny too. It was like watching a tv show...they love to cook and it shows. I would stay at this hotel just for these two guys.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice paired with really average”
Reviews.Author: tandrys
Reviews.Content: The photos of the exterior pool on the website are absolutely accurate. The pool area is great, and there is an outdoor hot tub that was really the best part of the stay! Additionally, the guys at the front desk were incredibly helpful and friendly - couldn't have asked for better. We requested a 6am shuttle and it was right on time. We needed a place to eat Thanksgiving night, and were sent to a perfect Mexican restaurant. Finally, there is a bar on the top floor that has free drinks from 5-7. It was a nice way to wind down the day. The rooms were fine - they would have been good, but there was curling wallpaper, chipped wood trim, etc. Towels, sheets, everything were clean, but the basic decor was a little dingy. Also, the internet costs $5/hour or significantly more per day - silly. The neighborhood is commercial - Dunkin Donuts across the street. This was a fine place to stay the night before a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Tired - needs updating”
Reviews.Author: SFpol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Embassy Suites because it was close to the office I was visiting. While the price was good, most of the hotel was pretty not worth it. The rooms need updating and the bathroom sink is directly across from the bed, which is kind of odd. One of my biggest complaints was the laziness of some of the staff. I got some snacks at the evening reception one night and after housekeeping cleaned my room the following day, they placed the plate outside my door on the ground. It then remained there until sometime overnight the following night! This happened two nights in a row. Frankly, I would prefer you leave the dish in the sink where I placed it instead of outside where I or someone else could accidentally step on it. And one morning some type of fan was just outside my door as well and it also just sat there on the walkway until late that night. They also had a water outage overnight, which didn't affect me, but I would have preferred that Hilton show this on their website at the time of booking, or when I checked in, instead of getting a flyer under my door at 8pm! Staff at breakfast were incredibly nice and the pool looked nice though I didn't use it. The gym is brand new - quite a contrast to the rest of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've been in, in 6 years”
Reviews.Author: Mudrock
Reviews.Content: Service was not the issue. Hotel is in very poor condition. Rooms are very dated and not secure. Doors and windows are dirty, single pane and not sound or weather insulated. carpet, covers, sink, bathroom very dirty and repulsive. bathroom small and fan works only with the light. water was not hot enough, poor soap and shampoo selection. Poor towel and wash cloth. sink as outside the bathroom, in a vanity in the bedroom. small countertop, no space for toiletries, mirror was old and dirty, over sink light was down light so hard too your face to shave (or apply make-up I imagine). Close to the airport (kind of close I guess), Not all that close. bus runs every 30 minutes, breakfast was OK, but slow cook and I felt like I was in a high school cafateria. Bar tender was a nice guy, dirnks were fine. food in the bar was OK, not great.

Reviews.Title: “A very tired property convenient to the airport”
Reviews.Author: dkenglish7
Reviews.Content: From the missing elevator to the dangling light fixture in my room, from the industrial grade indor-outdoor carpet to the roar of the one-speed AC system, this property calls out for a major remodel. The pool area did look clean and inviting though we did not partake. The property had the standard amenities expected of an Embassy Suites, but if we had waited in line behind all the employees and contractors for the free cooked breakfast, we would never have made our flight. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable, but for some inscrutable reason the bathroom was tiny. It was not possible to sit on the seat without making contact with the toilet paper holder. I'm sure there are better choices equally convenient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Night at Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Ilovebostons
Reviews.Content: Arrival in Phoneix, the afternoon before the actual tour starts. We collect bags and hop on the free shuttle to Embassy Suites on 24th st. We noticed mixed reviews on the Tripadvisor.com, but with pre-pay advanced purchase deal we were happy to try it for a pre-tour night. The hotel was lovely, the pool was beautiful, the whirlpool nice and hot. It was 100 degrees at 6:30 pm. We ate at 5 MST (8 EST) and took advantage of the manager's reception beverages. The next day we woke early, 6 am MST and had a delicious full breakfast in the breakfast room, the butter paintbrush was wielded with a heavy hand by the cook, eaning his pancakes good reviews from Jack and Isabel. Another 3 hours in the pool and the sun was directly overhead, all shade was lost. Time to head back to Sky Harbor Airport to meet up with our Adventures by Disney group. We have the shuttle bus to ourselves, and say good-bye to the Embassy Suites, promising ourselves to rate it highly on the tripadvisor site, as we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible; the best staff and stay I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: trinity07kc
Reviews.Content: I had the most wonderful stay at the Embassy. I had never stayed at one before, and my trip was unexpected. While at the airport it was suggested I stay at your hotel. I checked in with Lacey King, the manager and Indhi Dailly. I was very impressed. My father was at the Veterans State Home dying and finally past on my last day in town. Lacey went above and beyond to do everything to make my stay as comfortable as possible. I didn't have to ask her for anything as she offered me the things she thought I needed along with kind words. The shuttle took me to and from the Veterans Home everyday and the drivers were great. Great employees, great room, great food!

Reviews.Title: “Not one of Embassy Suites Best Properties!”
Reviews.Author: cadeltafoto
Reviews.Content: I selected the Embassy Suites at 24th Street knowing full well that the neighborhood is a bit less than desireable and the location is not really near the Airport, but was close to my work. The rooms are smallish to Embassy standards and several were in the process of being upgraded while I was there. While the rooms are clean and the pool area is exceptional, I can't say as much for the resturant. The selection is not much better than a typical greasy-spoon joint and the service was fair, at best. Having been bitten once by poor food, I ate elsewhere during my stay, even though that requires a car trip. The front desk staff was acceptable, but the Day Manager really did shine - always greeting me and asking if I needed anything. Overall, I would not stay here again. There are better places within the same value range in the same general area.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected stay at Embassy Suites ended up being delightful!”
Reviews.Author: zoohouse
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a cancelled flight and ended up needing to spend the night in Phoenix (which delayed our vacation starting one day). We chose the Embassy Suites for our one night stay and found the hotel to be nothing short of delightful. The property was lovely. The pool was so nice with shady areas and lots of pool "toys" including things to float on. We enjoyed the pool a great deal! Our room was spacious and clean. The lobby was lovely and the eating areas very nice. But what set this place apart was the service. Everyone who worked here was friendly, funny, and welcoming. We ended up feeling not like our vacation was delayed in starting but like we had a mini vacation in Phoenix. From our airport pick-up to our airport drop-off the next day everyone was exceedingly helpful. The suites have a shuttle bus and they are willing to take you anywhere within a five mile radius for free as long as they aren't doing an airport pick-up. We were looking for a place to get Indian tacos. The front desk looked it up for us, took us there to get food, and brought us back no problem. There is a manager's reception in the cafe each afternoon and we got free drinks and there were also snacks to eat. We went up there to wait for our shuttle to dinner and they just called the bar when they were ready to take us. The made to order breakfast the next morning was fast and delicious!!! The man cooking it up was adorable and came over to make sure our food was good. I just don't have a word of complaint about this facility. I have no idea about the area we were staying in since we weren't there to sight-see but for a reasonable place to stay with excellent service - you can't beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Embassy Suites With a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: tkbocl
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 almost almost stays at Embassy Suites, and this one is different from any I have ever seen. I will end the review with some good points, so read on, but I'll start with the bad.... -It looks scary when you drive up (our first thought was, "This is an ES?") -rooms are dark inside -bathroom was tiny (I could stand in the middle and easily touch all 4 walls without moving) -the bathroom is in the bedroom (whereas in most ES properties it is entered in the common area.) -wallpaper was peeling in bathroom, ceiling was peeling in bedroom -A/C barely worked (I'm not sure if it was really working at all but fortunately we hit Phoenix on a good weekend.) -Carpet looked nice, but kids feet were black on the bottom within 5 minutes (so it wasn't so clean) So, as not to be totally negative, here are my complements: -staff was incredible at every turn -workout area was top notch (but the ceiling was so low I had to slide out a ceiling tile to use the elliptical machine.) -breakfast was good; no hot bar like some ES, but the cook was excellent and really kept the line moving -the pool area was nice, with plenty of shade and well-supplied towels -it was quiet at night That all being said, I would not stay at this ES again. To the staff, I'm sorry for this review, but Hilton would be well-served to take their great staff to another location more in line with their ES branding. I'll finish with my complaint about all ES hotels - charge a few extra dollars and give us free wireless. I think it's a joke that you can get free wireless at Comfort Inn but not at ES properties. (sorry for typos, I did this on the plane )

Reviews.Title: “I didnt know Embassy Suites had scary hotels like this one.”
Reviews.Author: kreskyhr
Reviews.Content: If you are into stinky, dirty rooms, this hotel is for you. This hotel is obviously some sort of buy out of another as it's nothing like any ES I have ever stayed in. I think we could all agree that with Embassy Suites there is a level of expectations and this one is NOT up to ES standards. Upon opening the door (after multiple tries with the key) when it finally did open, the first thing that hit you was the indescribable smell. The rooms are dated, the carpet and furniture is mismatched and dirty, and the wallpaper peeling. The bathroom is microscopic and again, the smell is what really turned me off. I went to the front desk and asked if there were any remodeled rooms and the clerk "Edith" said they just remodeled the place a little over a year ago and all the rooms are alike. She did enlist a nice man to show me the room next door which did smell better, but appeared to be equally as worn and dirty. I didnt see the point in moving since my kids were already in the room next door. The man also admitted that some rooms smell better than others. My question to all these people would be "Why don't you do something to make all your rooms smell CLEAN rather than some smelling better than others?" She offered me an air freshener. If it were up to me, I'd leave and ask for a refund. But my husband is tired of driving so we are stuck here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a short stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: xsvenx
Reviews.Content: Booked it via Priceline for a very inexpensive rate. First hotel on our trip this year to the Four-Corners-Region. Can only recommend the Hotel. Friendly staff, spacious and clean rooms. Easy to reach from the airport. The area the hotel is located might be not too good - won't advise to head out for a walk in the evening. But the hotel itself is without a doubt highly recommandable.

Reviews.Title: “Almost everyone has a view of the pool”
Reviews.Author: 1jamorty
Reviews.Content: All rooms in this hotel face the courtyard pool. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Hopefully they have left Happy Hour up in the bar and not tried to move it back down into the breakfast area again.

Reviews.Title: “Good rate, nice room, close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: RyanP85
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a night after our plane was delayed because of bad weather. The airline got us a nice discount and our room was big and clean with a comfortable bed. We were gone the next morning, so that's really all we wanted. The free breakfast was a nice cherry on top.

Reviews.Title: “Whole lotta banging going on..”
Reviews.Author: Captainmommy
Reviews.Content: Arrived last night for 2 night stay after midnight. The cost for two nights is $300. Since early this morning there has been a lot of construction noise. The hotel is very dated, but clean. I think this is the saddest Embassy Suites I have ever stayed in...really needs a facelift. The breakfast was ok, but nothing to get excited about. We have not seen the maid so we raided her cart parked just outside our door for clean towels, made our own bed....self service? When I have the opportunity I generally stay at an Embassy Suites, just stayed at the Miami Airport one about a week ago and the two hotels are worlds apart. This is more like a Days Inn than an Embassy, certainly not up to Embassy Suites standards one would expect. Not a good value for the price I paid and I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall it's worth it...”
Reviews.Author: HappyHoundsCO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while in Phoenix for business, and really don't have any big complaints. No, it's probably not quite as nice as many other Embassy suites - the building is a bit older, and the furnishings in the rooms could be updated. But overall it's a comfortable, clean hotel with the great Embassy Suites breakfast, and a very welcome "Manager's Reception" every weeknight at the hotel bar/ restaurant on the top floor. The staff were always helpful and nice, and the pool area was better than expected. If I have one gripe, it's that they charge $11 per night for internet access. That is really puts them at a disadvantage these days with most hotels offering free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Jr?”
Reviews.Author: PowerhouseD
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, we felt that this particular Embassy Suites is not really up to the standards of the chain. If this is your first Embassy Suites experience, you might be afraid to try another. Don't be fooled: every other Embassy Suites we have ever stayed at is well worth the price. We stayed at this one for a stopover on our drive back to L.A. after Christmas. The pluses: the hotel is close to I-10 (via the 51 freeway); the bedroom was huge; the bed, pillows, sheets and blankets were very comfortable; our room had a small balcony that we could step out on; and the breakfast was tasty. The minuses: the sofabed and living room that became our teen son's room were both very small as was the bathroom; there was only one cook making eggs, pancakes, potatoes, and french toast; the coffee maker was broken but got fixed just as my wife finished her breakfast; and the parking lot is small. Oh, and you still have to pay for Internet access: it cost us an extra $5 when we booked the room online at the Hilton website. We did not make the manager's reception on the fifth floor as we were out to dinner at Cracker Barrel (a good twelve miles away), so I can't comment on that. However, our son wanted to use the spa, but it was under renovation (the website said it the renovation was to be completed two weeks before our stay). The front desk clerk told our son that a shuttle could transport him to a nearby Hilton or Embassy Suites and he could use that pool, but we put a kabash on that plan: who wants to travel from one hotel to another on the airport shuttle wearing a wet swim suit???? (My guess is, besides our son, NOBODY!) So for $100 dollars we got some comfort and a decent breakfast (after a 20 minute wait in line), a bedroom that could fit four beds, a living room that could fit four people and a bathroom that could only fit a four-year old.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: TEH3
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 100+ nights. Biggest plus is the staff is incredible! Even though this is an older property they have replaced all carpet, all TVs with flat panels, and re-coated the deck around the pool since I arrived. The made to order breakfasts are wonderful and the manager's reception is a welcome plus at the end of the day. I recommend it highly especially if you are on an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was "top notch"; a delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: smerchant13
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hotel because it offered 24 hr. shuttle service to the Airport. The swimming pool and spa were great with a garden like shady atmosphere. Evening Mgr. reception with Cocktails was an added bonus. Breakfast was superb with entertaining Chefs to make my omelets. But the most exceptional thing was that the Hotel offered to take us off site to the restaurant of our choice using the Hotel shuttle. I believe that the staff went above and beyond to make our experience at their Hotel exceptional. I would definitely recommend this Embassy Suites property.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from an Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: turtlebean
Reviews.Content: We often stay at Embassy Suites with our family since it easily accomidates young children and its generally a high quality brand. However our stay at this hotel did not measure up. The room entrances are on the outside and the room interior was not in good shape. Our 10 year old nearly pulled the front of a cabinet off as he pulled on it, thinking it was a drawer. There was thick visible dirt on the carpet underneath the cabinetry (which was several inches off the floor so easily visible and accessible). The bathroom sink didn't drain (yuck). In the Phoenix heat, the AC unit could not keep up. Also there was a sliding glass door out to a balcony of sorts. There was a large gap at the bottom of the railing that an adult could slip through. The pool area was very nice as was the staff, but it just seemed like they slapped the Embassy Suites label on a pretty run down property. It was a disappointment to me since staying at Embassy Suites is usually quite a treat for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Choice”
Reviews.Author: NZ_4
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is an older property. Yes, it has external access to rooms (a la motels). However, the rooms are large, well appointed and clean. The breakfast is excellent (the duo making the omeletes to order are friendly and make great food - thanks guys) and the cocktail hour in the rooftop restaurant is a pleasant way to finish the day. The pool is big and clean, all staff that we had contact with were friendly and accommodating and there are security staff at night who watch over your parked car. We chose this hotel for value for money and proximity to the airport and we were not disappointed. Don't expect the same standard as other Embassy Suites, but highly recommended, nonetheless, on the basis of value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on your needs”
Reviews.Author: lewis&clark
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times for business meetings at this hotel. If you are looking for a really nice hotel, then stay at the Embassy Suites Biltmore. This is more of a value hotel. This hotel was not originally an Embassy Suites. But if you are looking for Value--especially if you have kids, then this is a very good choice. The reason- free breakfast and I'm not talking Continental. I'm talking Omlettes, French Toast, or whatever way you want your eggs, bacon, sausage plus all the other normal contential breakfast choices. Plus, they have a free happy hour from 5-7. So consider what you would spend on Breakfast and on alcohol (if you drink) then this place comes out pretty inexpensive. The pool is nice and clean. The rooms are large, but dated. All the doors face inward toward the courtyard. I had mixed feelings when I stayed there the first time, but since I've stayed there 4 other times, I appreciate it's value much more.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ratherbeintahiti
Reviews.Content: I'm going to preface this with the fact that this is the first time that I've ever decided to go on-line and write a bad review on a property. I have been to 30+ countries and have stayed in hostels and 5 star hotels and am not normally a complainer. That being said, this hotel warrants a complaint. In my opinion the major benefit and reason to stay at an Embassy Suites over any other property is the complimentary hot breakfast and cocktail hour. I stayed at this hotel b/c of it's proximity to the airport and I had an early flight and a long day flying, so chose the Embassy Suites so I could start out my day with a hot breakfast. Upon check-in I was told breakfast did not start until 6:30, which I was shocked by as it is an airport hotel and you'd think the breakfast would at least start by 6 for the majority of travelers that have early flights. The desk clerk told me that I could get a to-go breakfast box earlier than 6:30, and that those would be ready and out by 6. I was downstairs at 6, and there were no breakfast boxes. The desk clerk told me that they were just finishing brewing coffee and they would be right out. Five minutes later I was still waiting, and asked the desk clerk if I could just get a box to go, that I didn't need coffee. He told me no. I told him that I had a flight to catch and would get no meals on the plane and asked if he just wouldn't mind calling the kitchen and seeing if they had anything ready, and he refused to call. Mind you, I made a very polite request for him to call the kitchen and check on the boxes, so I was absolutely shocked when he said no. I had to get the shuttle to the airport with no breakfast and buy something at the airport. I should have stayed at Motel 6. I bet they had their continental breakfast out before 6:30 and I could at least have gotten a muffin there. They also charge $9.95/day for wireless internet access. Wow. Do yourself a favor and stay at another hotel that gets that customer service is the only thing that separates successful from unsuccessful businesses in this economy.

Reviews.Title: “This Embassy Suites is not on par with the rest of the hotel chain”
Reviews.Author: nhpod
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at a wonderful Embassy Suites in Covington Ky two weeks prior to staying at this one. Our first clue about this hotel is the neighborhood. It is dangerous and we had to deal with many questionable people at the convenience store down the road. When we checked in at 10:00 pm the clerk only had three rooms left for us: A room facing a very busy street , a handicapped room, or a smoking room. Fortunately I prevailed upon the clerk ( perhaps because I was Hilton Honors) to give us a " better room". The "better room" was a dingy motel-style room which was musty and freezing. A sign informs guests that they cannot turn down the AC -- however they are welcome to borrow a space heater if they are cold. There were bugs in the bathroom, wallpaper was peeling, and the room was filthy. The woman serving the cooked to order breakfast was surly.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: smudgecat360
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel overnight on our way back from Sedona (we were flying out of Sky Harbor the next day). My first impression of the place wasn’t great as it had a “motel feel” and not what I would have expected of an Embassy Suites. It’s clearly an older property and it also bordered on a questionable area of town, although the main strip that it was situated on seemed fine, and there was decent security. That said, the room was large and with a king bed, a kitchenette and separate sitting area. It did seem a bit dated, and the cinder block walls didn’t exactly add to the charm, but it was clean and spacious. As other posters have noted, temperature control was an issue, and our room was rather stuffy. However, the complimentary made-to-order breakfast was good and what I saw of the pool area seemed nice enough. I probably wouldn’t have been thrilled if we were spending our whole vacation here, but for one night it was acceptable. I do think that the pictures on the website are a bit misleading, though, and make it look more luxurious than it really is. As a side note, my husband discovered a mysterious $50 extra charge on our credit card originating from this hotel. It wasn’t on our bill, so whether it was an error or something more sinister, I’m not sure. In any event, make sure to check your statement carefully.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay and well worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: Chicagovacationer08
Reviews.Content: I guess I am confused as to why people complained about this hotel. As I am reading some of the other reviews about noise and bad service, are you sure you stayed here? There were at least 5 youth boys travelling basketball teams that were in our hotel and I had no idea they were even staying here until we saw them at breakfast. Yeah, it may not be in the Beverly Hills of Phoenix, but the staff here made seem as if it were. We travelled with a 10 year old and a 5 month old and had Absolutely no problems while we were here. We checked in after 10pm and with a tired baby, we figured that we were in for a long night getting her back on a schedule. The staff was quick with a baby crib and very complimentary about our baby and our needs when she arrived at our room . The mgrs cocktail hour is great after a long day or sighseeing and busy stuff in Phoenix. And nothing like sitting outside of that bar overlooking the courtyard where the pool is and seeing the mountains off in the distance. The pool area was clean and always stocked with fresh towels. The breakfast parlor was also clean and well kept. The chefs keep the place hoping and could always put a smile on your face. They went above and beyond their duty to take care of my son's personal requests for his breakfast. I do recommend though to check their busy times as the wait can be long for the grill portion of the breakfast. We missed one day there due to a late start that morning and ended up walking next door to a local restaurant. Overall, our stay and the service we received was well over the top. I want to be sure that if we can travel with a baby and be quite accommodated with our needs, then you can too. We will definitely come back to this hotel on our next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Some good Some bad”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal401
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel did not quite live up to what I thought an Embassy Suites should be. Some of the staff was extremely friendly and accomodating, generally the staff during the day. The night staff was a little more hit and miss. We stayed a week on business. My room was exceptionally hot at night, and being on the second floor overlooking a parking lot, I did not want to leave my windows open. The AC did not work. On my last night I finally called to complain, at 10pm, and the "engineer" came with a fan. The hotel was nowhere near full, they could easily have moved me. Finally, when I couldn't lock my sliding door, I called again and was moved. The hotel seemed reasonably clean, however, I developed a bacterial infection in my eyes (similar to pinkeye). It appears to be a 1970s apartment complex that was turned into a hotel--and not renovated in this century for sure. The free breakfast is decent; the chefs who cook to order were all incredibly nice and efficient. The hotel restaurant was ok as well, nothing terrific. The workout room was actually one of the nicest I have ever seen. Did not seem to fit with the rest of the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, great amentieis”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMinnesota
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites has a great pool area, breakfast extraordinare and great suites. The rooms are large and have microwave, refrigerator and very comfortable. An outside entrance to pool and breakfast area. Specially prepared omelets, with a flair from the omelet artist are part entertainment and great tasting. We visited in December and there were people swimming in immaculate pool and hot tub surrounded by great landscaped. Grocery stores close and easy to find. Bed comfortable, showers well maintained. Easy to relax after a long day of travel, beautiful surroundings

Reviews.Title: “Totally Delighted!”
Reviews.Author: SpicynShellie
Reviews.Content: I had to book a last minute business trip to Phoenix and selected this location. Of course, I was in a rush and did not check Trip Advisor before hand. After I read the reviews, I nearly cancelled my stay. I am so happy that I did not do that. This property really over delivered! Complimentary airport shuttle and complimentary local area shuttle was just so convenient. Don, the driver, was amazing, friendly and caring, who remembered every detail about where I was going, and took good care of me. The 2 lovely ladies at check in were friendly and ever so helpful. My suite was immaculate and quiet. The bed was one of the best and I slept better than I have in any hotel. Complimentary Breakfast and Evening Cocktail Gathering were excellent. Good coffee is my hot button and their coffee was pretty good! Every staff member except the person who checked me out, went over and above and seem to truly love their work. I wouldn't recommend taking a long walk in this neighborhood but I felt totally safe at the hotel. There is a 7/11 across the street which was fine. My suite had a refrigerator and microwave which was a great touch to store and heat up left overs. This property is 2 miles south of The Biltmore Shopping Center and the drivers will take you from door to door. I did not hear a sound at night so the construction was solid. Kudos to Embassy Suites on Thomas Road for delighting this very picky traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Worked Well for Us”
Reviews.Author: Hbmomof4
Reviews.Content: Having booked this room awhile back without checking Tripadvisor first, I was dismayed when I finally read the reviews last week before our trip. Since it was too late to change anything we went ahead with out plans to stay at this hotel. We found that, yes, it's in an older neighborhood that is a bit run down in places. However, we never feared for our safety once. Security and hotel staff were always present in the parking lots and on the premises. The front desk staff were helpful and kind. The morning chefs were fantastic and fun individuals. They took the time to help you with any requests you might have and were very cheerful in doing so. The pool area was clean and neat to see at night with the gas lamps that surrounded it. The only major drawback to this hotel was it's age. Supposedly its going through a remodel, but I found that the aging property didn't reduce our satisfaction as a family of 6.

Reviews.Title: “Place was not good”
Reviews.Author: Jeff2007
Reviews.Content: It's actually a motel, and is located in a dangerous area. The motel is quite old and in need of a major overhaul or tear down. There was an airport shuttle and the staff was friendly and helpful. When I arrived it was 81 degrees, the hotel controls the heat/air for the entire building, the individual users can't. They didn't have the air on and the front desk gave me a fan after complaining. Even when air is on, it's still not that cold. You have to drive everywhere to get out of the bad area. The pool and spa were nice and clean. The workout room consists of 3 treadmills.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: Boston25
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel we've ever seen. SO much so that we left. It was dirty, rundown, and old, with mismatched and dirty furnishings. It's got a motel feel to it, with rooms opening to the outside center open courtyard and railings eveywhere you look, very dangerous set up for small children. We could not believe it was part of the Hilton family. The rate we had was $159/night. We left the same day, totally disgusted by the appearance and quality, and booked at the very nice airport Hilton for half the price. The website photos are very, very deceiving. It was a nightmare of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to like.”
Reviews.Author: Kitsilano
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's older, but there's a lot to like about this Embassy Suites property. We like the self-catering possibilities, with a microwave oven and fridge in the room and a gas barbecue available, dining in is easy (housekeeping provides dishes). The pool is well laid out for sun and shade. Custom-cooked breakfast and "happy hour" are included in the price. Ask for a room on the side without a parking lot for the quietest night. While there isn't much to walk to in the neighbourhood, there's a handy grocery store a block west and a decent Italian restaurant a few blocks east. Beer and wine are readily available at a market a block east.

Reviews.Title: “web access”
Reviews.Author: corpguy
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to understand how Hilton can justify charging $10 per day for in suite WIFI access when hotels charging less than a third the daily rate include it for nothing

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: sptsfan63
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older, but the service was great, the bed was comfortable and I couldn't hear a thing outside of my room. The hotel was very busy for the marathon occurring throughout the the town. Even with a full house, the service at the breakfast station was pleasant and fast. If you are used to other Embassy's you will be a little disappointed as this one is showing its age. Overall it still holds its own. I was also very happy with the parking lot security.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was nice!”
Reviews.Author: CLUBCHICK
Reviews.Content: Coming to the Embassy Suites, I immediately noticed I wasn't in Kansas anymore-- the surrounding area is less than desireable. I travelled alone to Phoenix to run the Rock N Roll Marathon Jan 13-16 and had a great trip. The hotel was nice, despite the neighborhood, and there was security on the premises.
