I didn't feel unsafe on the property. The room was very large. There was a nice living room, kitchenette with sink, fridge, and microwave. There was a desk with two chairs, which doubled as an eating area. The bedroom was separate from the living area, and quite comfortable. The beds were firmer than I like, but that's just me being picky. There was adequate storage- drawers, and armoire, and a television cabinet with storage underneath. The restroom was a bit on the small side, but I wasn't planning on spending a lot of time in there anyway!!! The staff went out of their way to help me out, and the bartender (Pat) was great! I mentioned that I hadn't been given safety pins (a necessity to a runner!) and forgot to bring them as well, so she went and found me a handful of them! It IS an older property, so I can see why people might be disappointed. I, however, thought it was great, and would definitely stay there again. My opinion differed from the other hotel guests I spoke with, but I think that was because I'd paid so much less. While they had paid upwards of $150/night, I had gotten the room for $50/night on priceline. This isn't a particularly romantic setting, so I wouldn't recommend it to lovers. But, the hotel is perfect if you want a place to hang out, sleep, and get free drinks from 530-730pm in the lounge. Some people were saying they made up for the overpriced hotel in free drinks!! The hot tub is nice and hot, and the heated pool was great, too. If you do get this hotel on priceline, don't panic- it is NOT as bad as it sounds. I would stay there again, and probably will next January, if I can get it on priceline again!

Reviews.Title: “Last Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Questionable area with poor parking lot. Rooms are worn and dirty. The showers do work SOMETIMES. The restaurant is not worth it and the happy hour is too cramped in the bar. The breakfast is very good and the cooks are the best employees there. Too many other hotels in the area to stay here. The 44th street Embassy Suites is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family joined me on a business trip to Phoenix so we could tour around and take in the Grand Canyon. We arrived Saturday afternoon and after checking into a third floor room, we immediately set out on a tour. We arrived back at the hotel late Saturday evening to wake up Sunday morning to set out for the Grand Canyon tour. As I was getting ready, I noticed something under the living room end table. Looking closer, it was dog poop and NO, we didn’t have a dog with us. After a couple of calls to the front desk, they sent someone to clean it up. Coming back from the Grand Canyon, there was a note under our door. The note read that the pool was going to closed for the rest of the week. The note also read that “If you have further questions or would like to relocate to another property, please contact a guest service agent”. I approached the night manager and asked him to relocate me to another property. His response was that it wasn’t his responsibility to find me another hotel. After much conversation, he ended up giving me the phone number to the Embassy Suites Phoenix North. Since I would be at work the next morning, the night manager did say that they would assist my wife and kids in getting our luggage to the Phoenix North via the hotel bus. The next morning I talked to the manager about moving our luggage. His response was that they were not going to move our luggage since it was outside of their three-mile driving limit. Needless to say, this impacted my Monday morning business meeting. By the way, the morning manager said that they allow pets on the first two floors.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this Embassy Suites hotel”
Reviews.Author: M_from_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: There are other hotels in the Phoenix airport area and you'd be well served to stay at most of them. This hotel is in a neighborhood in need of urban renewal, as evidenced by the fact that there are no other hotels in the immediate area whereas there are a number of bail bondsmen, gentlemen's clubs, low-rent apartements, etc.... The pool was "out of order". The AC in my room didn't keep the room cool, likely due to the outside temperatures of 115+ during the day and 100+ at 10 PM at night. I didn't rent a car and asked to have a taxi called. Both times a private Lincoln Town Car pulled up to take me to my destination. The rate was $3 per mile, which I expect is much higher than the going cab rate. My business took me over towards Tempe which is about 11-12 miles away, which futher underscored how inconvenient this hotel was. If this is the original Embassy Suites location as I heard, its time to shut it down since it doesn't meet the standards of any other I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read some of these reviews at I was suprised at what was written. The hotel itself is not located in the prime of areas. The exterior itself also appears to be in need of a good painting, but when you walk into the hotel and it's courtyard, you forget about everything outside. The staff itself were very friendly and personable. The service at the desk and happy hour was absolutely fabulous. Many of the managers and staff knew some of the guests which lead me to believe they have many repeat customers. The rooms were very clean, food was good quality. Some areas are in need of a renovation, but for the price paid of $159 a night, this was a great stay! I also found out from one of the desk clerks that this was the original Embassy Suites! Everything was in proper working order during my stay. My toilet was acting funny when I checked in, but after I contacted the staff, it was fixed in no time. I even got a call back after I checked in to see if there was anything else they could do for me! They actually seemed happy to have us there. Good place for your family, it is convenient and close to the Biltmore and downtown. They even provide shuttle transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Not high on Embassy Suites Scale”
Reviews.Author: Bamaman
Reviews.Content: Agree with previous poster, if you're used to Embassy Suites, this one might let you down a little. You do get the space (i.e 2 room suite), mini kitchenette, 2 TVs, cooked to order breakfast and happy hour etc... Our room was clean. The letdown might be the look of exterior corridors with bare concrete slabs facing an open courtyard (i.e no roof). However, we stayed there for 2 nights when we first arrived in Phoenix on 18 March and it was OK. The open courtyard actually looks pretty nice. On a normal scale of 1 to 10, I would give this place a 7. On a Embassy Suites scale, I would probably rate this place a 2 or 3. We stay in Embassy Suites all the time and this place is probably near the bottom of their scale.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Training HQ”
Reviews.Author: BoiseBaylorBears
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days in March 2004 while catching a few Spring Training games. If you are used to staying at Embassy Suites, this one may disappoint you since it is older and in a somewhat rundown neighborhood. There are no good dining options nearby. Because of that, we ate one meal at the on-site restaurant which turned out to be acceptable. However, for the price we paid, this was a great hotel in a central location to all the Spring Training Venues. Even the Rangers/Royals in Suprise were only 30 minutes away. The room was clean and since we were on the side away from the street, it was also quiet. If you are in Phoenix for other reasons like a weekend retreat to relax at a spa or get away from it all, you should spend the extra money to stay in Scottsdale or at a resort. However, if you are looking for a good deal on an Embassy in Phoenix, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got this room using Priceline - bid $50. Location was okay since it's close to the airport but the hotel and the room was excellent! It was clean, spacious with king bed, 2 tv's, clean, microwave, fridge, seperate bar sink, had complimentary water and cookies. Sad to missed the cooked to order breakfast but I'm sure that would have been great too!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bed suite last weekend to attend a wedding reception in Pheonix. My experience began poorly when I called from the car to get directions the day of my arrival. They advised me that my confirmation number was not valid and that they didn't have a reservation for me. I gave them the name of the person who I talked to and he said, "That's me." To make a long story short, I had to make a new reservation and they gave me a new confirmation #, which was very similar the one I had originally. (I will be checking my credit card statement to see if I was charged for two rooms) I knew they had lost my first reservation. Not a good start. We arrived, checked in, made our way up the (dirty) elevator to our room on the 4th floor. The pool looked nice but over crowded with screaming people. Our 2 bed suite was clean and spacious, and included a kitchenette and living room with big TV. We had no problems with the room itself. The next morning we went to the "complimentary breakfast" area that we knew ended at 10:30 (we weren't hungry, just looking for some coffee.) I walked through the (open) door at 10:31 and a man quickly snapped, "We're closed!" I softly asked where I could get a cup of coffee and he again snapped, "We're closed!" He was so rude and the way he raised his voice at us, I found to be totally unnecessary. All in all, I would say the hotel room itself was pretty nice for the $110 we paid, but the rest of the experience was just too unpleasant for us to return there. I've had many good stays at Embassy Suites, but this one just doesn't hold up to their reputation. They need to fire their current staff and start over from scratch. Maybe then I'd return.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a two night stay here booked through Expedia. Trying to find this place at night was my problem as I was checking the map as I drove. Checkin wasn't a problem and the staff was nice as I called earlier to tell them I wouldn't be there till 11pm. The parking lot looked deserted and this hotel is not enclosed like other Embassy Suites. This is an older facility and the rooms with older decor. It was 100 degrees outside and the AC worked fine. There was the mini bar plus fridge. The mircowave was circa 1985 as was the wardrobe closet and drawers. The bed wasn't the most comfortable, but I made due. This place isn't in the best part of town, but if you drive five to seven miles, it becomes alot better. Short drive to supermarkets and a Target store. I came here for the breakfast as I ate two helpings (yes, I'm a pig). I would stay at a newer place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve 3-star rating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a business trip to Phoenix where I stayed in the Embassy Suites on Thomas Rd. My stay there was a disaster from the beginning. If you are a government employee planning to stay here, don't count on getting a nice room. They relegate us to the far hidden corners of the hotel in rooms that have the oldest, smelliest, and low quality furnishings. The beds sagged in the middle and had absolutely NO support. There was a lump off to the side of my bed which I guess may have been mattress foam that had not been used to death. While the staff did change my room (3 times in 2 days) it was always with an "attitude". The first time I asked for a room change because I was in a corner room, next to the noisy ice/vending machines and unlocked gate leading to the parking lot. I felt very unsafe in this room. I was moved to another corner room, hidden in the back recesses of the hotel, again very unsafe feeling. This second room was the one with the so-called bed. The third room was a bit better but then let me tell you what happened! I was scheduled to check out on Friday. On Thursday, I had to go out of town for an overnight so I took my clothing with me but still left behind some personal items that I felt would indicate that I was returning to the room. Lo and behold when I returned to the room very early Friday morning, I found I had been "checked out" because the maid had been searching my room and had seen that my clothing was gone so I was automatically "checked out" despite the fact that I had a reservation until Friday and had left items behind. Of course, they couldn't find my books that I had left behind, my fruit and sodas had been confiscated, etc. What infuriates me is the fact that I had made sure to close the wardrobe doors and the dresser drawers so that it wouldn't be visible to the housekeeping staff that my clothing wasn't there. When I asked the head of housekeeping how the maid had come to the conclusion that I had vacated hes were gone." Why should the maid have been looking in the closed closet and drawers? Didn't the fact that my personal hygiene items were left in the shower indicate anything to her? I will NEVER stay in this hotel again. I am out a brand new hardcover book, a six-pack of sodas, a bag of oranges, shampoo, and a few magazines. If you want to be ripped off this is the place to go.

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Suites Phoenix Airport at 24th Street
HotelInfo.Address: 2333 E Thomas Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85016
